pullRequest.title: Moving all SSZ containers to backing structures (part 2)
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
Following up and on top of #3425

Refactor all the SSZ containers to backing tree structures using type-safe generated ContainerN classes
Since there is a concern regarding performance of new structures comparing to old POJO classes - create JMH benchmarks for some containers with basic usage scenarios
Make a number of optimizations in core ssz classes which speeds up the benchDeserializeAndIterate scenario ~3x for the most heavy BeaconBlockBody container
For optimization add custom caches (per each container individually) for heavy structures like BLSSignature, BLSPublicKey, Bitlist
Remove SimpleOffsetSerializable and HashTreeUtils functionality.
Add type-safe child type getters to generated ContainerTypeN classes

There is some stuff left to remove, but I'm planning to address this in the next PR #3512 to not make this PR even more noisy
To make container types more 'readable' added the following namedType. This also gives toString() 'for free':
      super(
          "AggregateAndProof",
          namedType("index", BasicViewTypes.UINT64_TYPE),
          namedType("aggregate", Attestation.TYPE),
          namedType("selection_proof", ComplexViewTypes.BYTES_96_TYPE));
instead of just
      super(BasicViewTypes.UINT64_TYPE, Attestation.TYPE, ComplexViewTypes.BYTES_96_TYPE);
Benchmarks
(Measured in microseconds per operation: the lower the better)

benchCreate : just constructing a container instance with its fields members
benchIterate: iterates all the members recursively. Worth to mention that subsequent iterations are very cheap due to View caches and are nearly as fast as POJO fields access
benchCreateAndIterate two above combined
benchCreateAndSerialize: benchCreate + SSZ serialize. New code is basically faster due to serialization is ~2x faster.
benchSerialize: just serialize existing instance
benchDeserialize: deserializing from SSZ. Can be faster than benchCreate
benchDeserializeAndIterate: I believe the most basic scenario for our structures other than BeaconState
benchDeserializeAndSerialize: another scenario which seems to be very common

commit.message: Add a couple of JMH benchmarks, change mode to usec/op
Adjust the testcase to expect UnsupportedOperationException until following refactor
Instead of prohibiting ViewWrite.getBackingNode() (and inherently ViewWrite.hashTreeRoot()) just commitChanges() for temp ViewRead. Add a warning that this could be suboptimal
Add handy util methods to ssz view classes

Merge remote-tracking branch 'ConsenSys/master' into feature/remove-old-ssz

# Conflicts:
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/forkchoice/VoteTracker.java
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/operations/AggregateAndProof.java
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/operations/Attestation.java
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/operations/IndexedAttestation.java
#	ssz/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/ssz/SSZTypes/Bitlist.java
#	ssz/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/ssz/backing/view/ViewUtils.java
Revert back accidentally committed debug changes
Update tests: add compare structures by getters
Make distinction: SszType [de]serializes backing tree, ViewType [de]serializes views
Too many caps: rename SSZType -> SszType
Add ContainerView toString() based on name types
Migrate some more containers to namedType
Migrate some more containers to namedType
Migrate the rest of containers to namedType

nodes.bodyText: Am I right in thinking that we now get the toString automatically from one of the super types?

Would be good to add a comment explaining what should be used instead now that this is deprecated. I am a little confused why people would need to specify a SszType and not just use this constructor (happened in another class as well).

Note that block by root requests aren't actually encoded as an SSZ list - they just concatenate the block roots. We have BeaconBlocksByRootRequestMessageEncoder to handle this and never actually SSZ encode or decode them.  They only implemented SSZContainer to make the type system happy originally (and it looks like that's not actually required anymore).
I don't think this is right as it will wind up serialising as a list rather than a vector.  Could be missing something though.

commit.message: Refactor BeaconBlocksByRootRequestMessage in a more canonical SSZ fashion: make it SSZ List as per spec instead of SSZ container
Fail fast if ssz exceeds maximum bounds for Lists and Vectors. Add test for this
Avoid generify element ViewType in CollectionViewType
Replace ContainerViewType constructor with factory method
Add type-safe container generated classes. Add generator
Migrate Checkpoint and AttestationData classes to type-safe containers
Return back the SSZContainer marker interface for now
Make Fork class pure backing View based
Move ContainersGenerator to a separate module. Add a gradle task to generate containers
Add the test checking that generated source files were not manually modified

Merge remote-tracking branch 'ConsenSys/master' into feature/remove-old-ssz

# Conflicts:
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/state/Fork.java
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/state/PendingAttestation.java
#	ethereum/datastructures/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/datastructures/state/Validator.java
#	ssz/src/test/java/tech/pegasys/teku/ssz/backing/CompositeListViewTest.java
Fix error in DefaultPerformanceTracker. Use merge() instead of compute()
Refactor BeaconBlockBody and all child containers
Fix error in SSZ size calculation
Temporarily tweak SimpleOffsetSerializer.getLengthBounds to refer to ViewType when available
Fix the tests checking container vector lengths
Add a tweak to pass the test. Container TYPE is now created statically so it doesn't reflect subsequent Constants modifications
Remove legacy SSZ stuff from containers
Minor optimization for ContainerViewType. Make all fields final
Regular loops are still far better than streams for performance critical code
Avoid creating per-view type instances: internal list container type is now created once inside ListViewType
Add specialized caches to containers with Bitlist, PublicKey and Signature fields
Add SszWriter interface instead of Consumer<Bytes>. Add SszByteArrayWriter. Optimize Bilist serialization
Fix missing local signature cache for SignedBeaconBlockHeader
Fix running JMH benchmarks from JAR file
Migrate more containers to new SSZ
Migrate more messages to new SSZ
Make List/VectorViewRead more usable with extending Iterable and adding stream() method
Refactor older containers to use type-safe ContainerN classes
Use dedicated Ssz type classes for containers instead of 'anonymous' types
Fix BeaconBlocksByRootRequestMessageEncoder.encode(): need to serialize the list only without wrapping container
Fix exception type thrown from DefaultRpcPayloadEncoder.decode()
Use dedicated Ssz type classes for containers instead of 'anonymous' types
Use more laconic predefined types for ByteVector48/96
Use more laconic predefined types for Byte/Bit Vector/List
Draft refactoring with using a Spec instance for ssz container types and instances creation
Generate child type getters for ContainerTypeN
Use Constants for now instead of the new Spec class
Add the right equals() for List/VectorViewType to correctly handle their subclasses
Add Ssz type descriptor to HistoricalBatch
Fix deserialization of bitvector with multiple 8 length
